meanings.definition: Lack of fluency in speech or writing.
meanings.sent1: Her nonfluency in English made it challenging for her to communicate with others.
meanings.sent2: The student's nonfluency in reading was evident when he struggled with pronouncing words.
meanings.sent3: Despite his nonfluency in Spanish, he attempted to order a burrito at the restaurant.
meanings.sent4: The nonfluency in her storytelling made the plot difficult to follow.
meanings.sent5: The nonfluency in his piano playing was like listening to a broken record.

meanings.definition: The state of not flowing smoothly or easily.
meanings.sent1: The nonfluency of the river was caused by a large rock blocking its path.
meanings.sent2: The nonfluency of the traffic was due to a construction detour.
meanings.sent3: The nonfluency of the dance routine made it look more like a comedy sketch.
meanings.sent4: The nonfluency of the conversation created an awkward silence in the room.
meanings.sent5: The nonfluency of the paintbrush strokes gave the artwork a unique texture.
